title: Acceleration and Deceleration
content:
Acceleration and Deceleration

The Hook

Ever felt pushed back into your seat when a bus suddenly speeds up, or lurched forward when it brakes suddenly? Your body experiences acceleration and deceleration every day!

The Concept

Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity. Formula: a = (v − u) ÷ t, where v is final velocity, u is initial velocity, and t is time. If velocity increases, acceleration is positive. If velocity decreases, it is called deceleration (negative acceleration). The SI unit of acceleration is m/s².

The Illustration

A cricket ball is bowled at 0 m/s and reaches 30 m/s in 0.5 s. Acceleration = (30−0)÷0.5 = 60 m/s². When your father brakes the car from 60 km/h to 0 in 5 seconds, the car is decelerating. Lorry drivers on NH highways must manage acceleration carefully to save fuel!
